hawkers.name: Adam Road Food Centre
hawkers.description: Built in 1974, Adam Food Centre comprises 32 cooked food stalls.  Although small in size, the hawker centre has a huge reputation.  Popular food offered in the centre includes BBQ Seafood, Nasi Lemak, Prawn Noodles etc.

hawkers.name: Amoy Street Food Centre
hawkers.address: National Development Building, Annex B, Telok Ayer Street
hawkers.description: Built in 1983, the two-storey food centre is located within the central business district.  Housing many well-known stalls, the centre has evolved into a favourite lunch venue for executives working near Shenton Way. Be spoilt by the choice of hawker fare at affordable prices!

hawkers.name: Bedok Food Centre
hawkers.description: Located at the corner of Upper East Coast Road, Bedok Food Centre is a favourite haunt for residents in the vicinity and army personnel from nearby barracks. Upgraded in 2005, the facade resembles that of an old Malay 'kampong' house. Famous for hawker fare such as Hokkien Mee, Desserts, Malay Dishes and more, the hawker centre houses 32 cooked food stalls.

hawkers.name: Beo Crescent Market
hawkers.description: Located near to Tiong Bahru MRT station and PSB Academy, Beo Crescent Market/Food Centre was built in 1965.  The centre serves the mature estate of Havelock and Tiong Bahru area.

hawkers.name: Berseh Food Centre
hawkers.description: Located along Jalan Besar Road, Berseh Food Centre houses 66 cooked food stalls. Built in 1975, the food centre presents an added nostalgic flavour with the rows of meticulously restored pre-war shophouses surrounding it.

hawkers.name: Bukit Timah Market
hawkers.description: Located along Upper Bukit Timah Road, the two-storey hawker centre was built in 1975 and was upgraded in 2003. A popular hawker centre serving the dining and marketing needs of residents living around Toh Yi Drive. Well-known for the variety of hawker fare, the centre is usually packed with patrons during peak hours. Comprises 84 cooked food stalls and 94 market stalls.

hawkers.name: Chomp Chomp Food Centre
hawkers.description: Located in Serangoon Gardens, Chomp Chomp Food Centre is well-known for its vibrant dinner and supper scene. Bustling with diners even till late at night, the 36 cooked food stalls in the small hawker centre serve popular local dishes such as Char Kway Teow, BBQ Chicken Wings, Seafood etc. This Centre attracts food lovers from all over the island.

hawkers.name: Commonwealth Crescent Market
hawkers.description: The 63 market stalls are located on the lower level while the 39 cooked food stalls are located on the upper level of this two-storey market. Built in 1965 to fulfill the marketing and dining needs of residents living in the mature estate of Commonwealth Drive.

hawkers.name: Dunman Food Centre
hawkers.description: Built in 1974, Dunman Food Centre has since played a vital role in providing resonably-priced cuisines to the residents of Joo Chiat area. Upgraded in 2002, the centre comprises 30 cooked food stalls.

hawkers.name: East Coast Lagoon Food Village
hawkers.description: Located in the south-eastern part of Singapore, the East Coast Lagoon Food Village offers a tropical resort ambience by the sea and a wide variety of local hawker food at reasonable prices. It is a favourite haunt among sports enthusiasts and families who wish to enjoy a sumptuous meal by the sea. Popular dishes include Satay, BBQ Seafood and Chicken Wings, Zi Char, Wan Ton Noodles, Satay Bee Hoon, Beef Noodles etc.  Rated as one of the food paradises in Singapore!

hawkers.name: Geylang Serai Market
hawkers.description: One of the most popular hawker centres in Singapore, especially with the Malay community! The hawker centre was upgraded in 2009 and currently comprises 63 cooked food stalls and 302 market stalls. Its design, which was conceived after close consultations with grassroots and stallholders, is reminiscent of rural Malay architecture. It is the third biggest hawker centre in Singapore based on stall count.

hawkers.name: Golden Mile Food Centre
hawkers.description: Home to lock-up stalls selling army stuff, Golden Mile Food Centre is a 'must go' place if you are looking for affordable army / camping equipment. The food section located at the first and second levels definitely does not pale in comparison. It offers well-known local and international cuisines by 111 cooked food stalls. Fanciful food selection at great prices!

hawkers.name: Holland Village Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Situated right in the heart of Holland Village, the hawker centre was built in the pre-war years. One of the hawker centres with the longest history in Singapore! Surrounded by restaurants and bistros, the hawker centre remains a popular choice for patrons with its offering of affordable hawker fare. Comprises 21 cooked food stalls and 48 market stalls.

hawkers.name: Kallang Estate Market
hawkers.description: Located just minutes away from Blk 51 Old Airport Road, the Kallang Estate Fresh Market and Food Centre provides both dining and marketing services for Kallang residents. Built in 1959, the centre comprises 16 cooked food stalls and 78 market stalls.

hawkers.name: Market Street Food Centre
hawkers.address: 50, Market Street, Golden Shoe Multi-Storey Car Park, 2nd/3rd Storey
hawkers.description: Due to the redevelopment of Market Street Food Centre (Golden Shoe Carpark) an interim hawker centre has been built to ensure continuity of stallholders' business and availability of affordable food options for patrons in the vicinity.  The interim centre commenced operations on 1 Aug 2017.

hawkers.name: Maxwell Food Centre
hawkers.description: Maxwell Food Centre began its roots in 1935. One of the iconic hawker centres in Singapore, the food centre now consists of 103 cooked food stalls. Popular hawker fare such as Chicken Rice, Tapioca Kueh, Porridge, Desserts and more can be found here.

hawkers.name: Newton Food Centre
hawkers.description: Popular with both locals and tourists alike.  Often rated by foodies as one of the best hawker centres in Singapore, Newton Food Centre is well known for dishes like BBQ Seafood, Hokkien Mee, Po Piah, Satay, Fried Carrot Cake etc.  Extremely crowded during dinner and supper time, this is definitely a hawker centre that you must visit!  Located in the Cairnhill / Newton area and a stone's throw away from Newton MRT.

hawkers.name: North Bridge Road Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Originally built in 1973 as a two-storey building. North Bridge Road Market was converted into a single-storey hawker centre after its upgrading in 2005. The centre now comprises 37 cooked food stalls and 82 market stalls.

hawkers.name: Pasir Panjang Food Centre
hawkers.description: Situated along Pasir Panjang Road and near to industrial estates, the food centre comprises 45 cooked food stalls and serves a variety of hawker fare including BBQ Seafood and Zi Char. Built in 1978.

hawkers.name: Serangoon Garden Market
hawkers.description: Within walking distance from the famous Chomp Chomp Food Centre, the spacious Serangoon Garden Market is an alternative food paradise where residents satisfy their palates.  Equipped also with a market produce section, patrons can discover true gems within the centre.  Take a look around and you can't miss those stalls that are highly rated by food gurus!

hawkers.name: Sembawang Hill Food Centre
hawkers.description: Built in 1974, this centre is nestled along Upper Thomson Road and offers a wide variety of food such as Fish / Seafood Soup, Char Kway Teow, Ngoh Hiang, Pasta etc.  The centre comprises 36 cooked food stalls.

hawkers.name: Taman Jurong Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Taman Jurong Market and Food Centre is an amalgamation of  3 hawker centres, namely Corporation Drive Market, Yung Sheng Food Centre and Corporation Drive Food Centre. Comprises 123 cooked food stalls and 57 market stalls.

hawkers.name: Tanglin Halt Market
hawkers.description: Built way back in 1964, Tanglin Halt Market is an iconic hawker centre within the Tanglin Halt estate. The hawker centre was given a facelift in 2003, and currently comprises 28 cooked food stalls and 89 market stalls.

hawkers.name: Tiong Bahru Market
hawkers.description: Located in one of the oldest and most charming neighbourhoods, Tiong Bahru Market was built in 1950 as a single-storey centre.  The centre merged with Blk 84 and 84A Lim Liak Street during the upgrading in 2006, and was converted into a three-storey building: market stalls on the ground floor, cooked food stalls on the second floor and a carpark on the third. It is the fourth largest hawker centre in Singapore with 259 market stalls and 83 cooked food stalls! Well-known for the many popular stalls within the centre.

hawkers.name: Zion Riverside Food Centre
hawkers.description: Located opposite Great World City, Zion Riverside Food Centre boasts a huge reputation even with its relatively small footprint of 32 cooked food stalls. Built since 1976, patrons can find a variety of good food offerings at the centre. Popular with both locals and tourists alike.

hawkers.name: ABC Brickworks Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Fondly known as ABC Brickworks Market, it is within close proximity to Alexandra Food Village and IKEA. The hawker centre, which was built in 1974, is another alternative for the residents of Queenstown and Bukit Merah.  Patrons can find delicious yet affordable hawker fare at the centre.

hawkers.name: Albert Centre Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Strategically located near places of interests like the famous Guan Yin Temple and Bugis Village, the hawker centre is popular with both locals and tourists alike. A wide array of good local cuisines is served by well-known stalls operating at the hawker centre.  The hawker centre is also famous for dried seafood items and textiles, sold at the lock-up stalls withiin the market section.

hawkers.name: Alexandra Village Food Centre
hawkers.description: Opposite the Queenstown Shopping Centre, the hawker centre, also commonly known as Alexandra Food Village, is home to a number of 'yummylicious' local dishes such as Chicken Rice, Claypot Laksa, Bak Ku Teh etc.

hawkers.name: Jalan Kukoh Market & Hawker Centre
hawkers.description: Built in 1969, Blk 1 Jalan Kukoh used to consist of both a market and food section. After upgrading in 2010, the centre was converted to a food centre with 21 cooked food stalls.

hawkers.name: Lorong Ah Soo Market
hawkers.description: Also known as Hougang 105 Hainanese Village Centre, the hawker centre underwent a major facelift in 2005. A very popular hawker centre in the Hougang area, especially during the weekends. Serving the needs of both the residents of Lorong Ah Soo as well as the industrial area across at Defu Lane, there are currently 51 cooked food stalls and 120 market stalls within the centre.

hawkers.name: Telok Blangah Crescent Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: The hawker centre was built in 1974 to serve the dining and marketing needs of residents living in the Telok Blangah area.  After its facelift in 2009, the upgraded centre boasts enhanced features such as ramps and wider circulation spaces for the physically challenged and elderly patrons.

hawkers.name: Jalan Bukit Merah Blk 112 Market
hawkers.description: Situated in the mature estate of Jalan Bukit Merah, the hawker centre at Blk 112 Jalan Bukit Merah satisfies both the marketing and dining needs of the residents nearby.

hawkers.name: Bukit Merah View Market & Hawker Centre
hawkers.description: Built in 1973, the hawker centre comprises 84 cooked food stalls and 167 market produce stalls. Located in Henderson area and near to office buildings, schools and residential flats, it is one of the largest hawker centres in Bukit Merah.

hawkers.name: Geylang East Centre Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Next to Geylang East Swimming Complex and other amenities, the hawker centre caters to the marketing and dining needs of the residents at Geylang East. The centre was built in 1978 and comprises 79 cooked food stalls and 82 market stalls.

hawkers.name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Built in 1969, the two-storey hawker centre comprises 40 cooked food stalls and 108 market stalls. Well-known for hawker fare such as Chicken Rice, Hokkien Mee etc, the hawker centre serves both the dining and marketing needs of Toa Payoh residents.

hawkers.name: Tampines Round Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Blk 137 Tampines Street 11 is the only hawker centre in the Tampines area. Also commonly known as Tampines Round Market due to the unique circular shape of the hawker centre, it was built in 1982 to fulfill the marketing and dining needs of the resident in Tampines Town. Comprises 45 cooked food stalls and 99 market stalls. The hawker centre was voted by readers of Shin Min Daily as their favourite hawker centre for 2 years running (2008-2009) in the City Hawker Food Hunt contest.

hawkers.name: Mei Ling Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Built in 1970 to serve the Mei Ling estate, the hawker centre at Blk 159 Mei Chin Road was upgraded in 2009 to improve circulation space and ventilation. Comprises 47 cooked food stalls and 66 market stalls.

hawkers.name: Bedok South Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Located near schools, factories and housing estates in the Bedok South area, this hawker centre is an accessible hotspot for patrons looking for an economical meal.

hawkers.name: Bukit Merah Hawker Centre
hawkers.description: Located in the heart of Bukit Merah Central, the food centre consists of 57 cooked food stalls. Extremely well liked by office executives working in the vicinity, the centre bustles with activity during lunch hours. Popular dishes include Ngoh Hiang, Chicken Rice, Teochew Porridge, Fish Soup, Char Kway Teow and Goreng Pisang. Be prepared to be spoilt for choice!

hawkers.name: Upper Boon Keng Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Upgraded in 2009, the hawker centre at Blk 17 Upper Boon Keng comprises 84 cooked food stalls and 60 market stalls. The hawker centre serves the nearby residential and industrial estates.

hawkers.name: Ghim Moh Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Built in 1977, the hawker centre is famous for its wide spread of offerings such as Char Kway Teow, Chicken Rice, Soya Bean Drinks etc. 72 cooked food stalls and 158 market stalls at the hawker centre serve Ghim Moh  residents daily.

hawkers.name: Bedok Interchange Hawker Centre
hawkers.description: Completed in 2014, this new food centre replaces the hawker centre at Blk 207 Upper Changi Road.  Also know as Bedok Interchange Hawker Centre,  it houses more seating areas for diners, more parking lots at the adjacent multi-storey carpark, and high-volume, low-speed cooling fans to provide patrons a more comfortable and cooler dining experience.  The centre also has NETS cashless payment system implemented at food stalls and free wireless internet connection via Wireless@SG for the convenience of patrons.

hawkers.name: Toa Payoh Lorong 8 Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Built in 1974, this hawker centre houses 80 cooked food stalls and 77 market stalls. One of the largest hawker centres in the Toa Payoh vicinity.

hawkers.name: 216 Bedok Food Centre & Market
hawkers.description: Built in 1979, the hawker centre at Blk 216 Bedok North Street 1 comprises 82 cooked food stalls and 114 market stalls. A stone's throw away from Bedok Town Centre.

hawkers.name: Kim Keat Palm Food Centre
hawkers.description: Built in 1970, the hawker centre at Blk 22 Lorong 7 Toa Payoh serves the Kim Keat residents and nearby industrial parks. There are 61 cooked food stalls and 59 market stalls in the hawker centre.  Be pampered by delicious hawker fare such as Oyster Omelette, Fishball Noodles, Zi Char etc!

hawkers.name: Blk 226D Ang Mo Kio Ave 1
hawkers.description: Located next to a food centre, the hawker centre at Block 226D Ang Mo Kio Ave 1 serves the marketing and dining needs of residents living in the Kebun Baru area. The centre was upgraded in 2010 and consists predominantly of market stalls.

hawkers.name: Ang Mo Kio Street 22 Blk 226H (Kebun Baru Food Centre)
hawkers.description: Commonly known as Kebun Bahru Food Centre, the food centre was built in 1976 to serve the dining needs of Kebun Baru residents. Comprises 29 cooked food stalls.

hawkers.name: Yuhua Village Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Located near to the PIE exit (Jurong Town Hall Road), the hawker centre at Blk 254 Jurong East Street 24 serves the marketing and dining needs of residents living in Yuhua Village.  There are 60 cooked food stalls and 87 market produce stalls operating within the hawker centre. Originally built in 1983.

hawkers.name: Bendemeer Food Centre
hawkers.description: Just a few minutes away from Boon Keng MRT station, the hawker centre is very popular with the nearby residents as well as the workers at Kallang Bahru Industrial Estate because of its location and affordable local cuisines.

hawkers.name: Shunfu Mart Food Centre
hawkers.description: Built in 2000, the hawker centre at Blk 320 Shunfu Road is the last hawker centre to be built. Also known as Shunfu Mart, the centre houses 31 cooked food stalls and 51 market stalls.

hawkers.name: Ang Mo Kio Ave 1 Blk 341 (Teck Ghee Court And Food Centre)
hawkers.description: Located in the heart of Teck Ghee estate and opposite Bishan Park, the 32 cooked food stalls and 86 market stalls within the hawker centre remain a popular choice among patrons despite the availability of alternative marketing and dining facilities nearby.  Popular local dishes are whipped up daily to satisfy patrons' desires for good food!

hawkers.name: Yuhua Market & Hawker Centre
hawkers.description: Located near to the PIE exit (Jurong Town Hall Road), the hawker centre at Blk 347 Jurong East Ave 1 is popular with residents living in the area. A wide variety of food and market produce is offered at the hawker centre by the 56 cooked food stalls and 169 market stalls. It was built in 1984 to cater to the dining and marketing needs of residents.

hawkers.name: Clementi Avenue 2 Market
hawkers.description: Built in 1978, the hawker centre has evolved into a focal point for residents to dine and engage in social bonding. Blk 353 Clementi Ave 2 comprises 18 cooked food stalls and 96 market stalls.

hawkers.name: Telok Blangah Rise Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Located near the scenic Mount Faber Park, the hawker centre has been serving the dining and marketing needs of residents in the vicinity since the 1970s.

hawkers.name: Teban Gardens Food Centre
hawkers.description: Located near Pandan Reservoir, the hawker centre comprises 28 cooked food stalls and 52 market stalls.  Built in 1976 to serve residents staying nearby.

hawkers.name: Teck Ghee Square Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Also known as Teck Ghee Square, it is one of the three hawker centres that are situated along Ang Mo Kio Ave 10. Built in 1979, the hawker centre comprises 40 cooked food stalls and 148 market stalls.

hawkers.name: Holland Drive Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: One of the last hawker centres to be built, Blk 44 Holland Drive has been serving the needs of residents since 1999. The two-storey hawker centre houses a market at the lower level and a food centre on the upper level. Conveniently located within walking distance from the Buona Vista MRT station.

hawkers.name: Clementi 448 Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Located in the town centre of Clementi, the hawker centre at Blk 448 Clementi Ave 3 is within walking distance from Clementi MRT station and the bus interchange. Good food offerings and its strategic location make the centre popular with diners.

hawkers.name: Chong Boon Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Built in 1979, the hawker centre at Blk 453A Ang Mo Kio Ave 10 consists of 38 cooked food stalls and 184 market stalls.

hawkers.name: Sims Vista Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Also known as Sims Vista Market and Food Centre, the hawker centre is nestled within the idyllic Sims Vista estate. Originally built in 1976, the hawker centre was upgraded in 2006 to improve its physical facade and provide a more hygienic environment for both stallholders and patrons alike. 66 cooked food stalls and 78 market stalls serve patrons of the hawker centre.

hawkers.name: Eunos Crescent Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: The hawker centre at Blk 4A Eunos Crescent is located within close proximity to the Eunos MRT station and bus interchange. Its strategic location coupled with a wide variety of food offerings results in high patronage especially during lunch and dinner hours.

hawkers.name: 4A Jalan Batu Hawker Centre
hawkers.description: Built in 1969, Blk 4A Jalan Batu comprises both a market and food section. The centre houses 52 cooked food stalls and 53 market stalls.

hawkers.name: Blk 502 West Coast Drive
hawkers.description: Also known as Ayer Rajah Market, the standalone market is located next to Ayer Rajah Food Centre. One of the last few hawker centres built, construction was completed in 1995 to complement Ayer Rajah Food Centre. There are 68 market stalls at the market to serve the West Coast area.

hawkers.name: Blk 503 West Coast Drive
hawkers.description: Also known as Ayer Rajah Food Centre, the standalone food centre was originally built in 1979.  The centre is located next to Ayer Rajah Market and currently houses 80 cooked food stalls to serve the West Coast area.

hawkers.name: Jurong West 505 Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: The hawker centre at Blk 505 Jurong West Street 52 was built in 1985.  Located in the heart of the Jurong West estate, the centre serves patrons from the nearby residential flats and schools.  Last upgraded in 2009, the centre comprises a total of 190 stalls - 60 cooked food and 130 market stalls.

hawkers.name: Marine Terrace Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Built in 1975 to serve the residents living within the Marine Terrace estate. The hawker centre is located just next to the Marine Parade Town Council. Comprises 24 cooked food stalls and 87 market stalls.

hawkers.name: Old Airport Road Food Centre
hawkers.description: The renowned Blk 51 Old Airport Road is famed for its excellent yet affordable food. Built in 1973, it consists of 168 cooked food stalls on the ground level and 54 lock-up stalls on the second level. The large number of cooked food stalls serve up an amazing array of cuisines, from local hawker fare to international food. Get thrilled by the gastronomic experience offered by the numerous stalls!

hawkers.name: Bedok North Street 3 Block 511 Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Built in 1979, the hawker centre at Blk 511 Bedok North Street 3 comprises 42 cooked food stalls and 83 market stalls to serve both the dining and marketing needs of residents living in the Kaki Bukit area. Be pampered by the wide selection of hawker fare!  Crowded during dinner and supper hours.

hawkers.name: Cheng San Market & Cooked Food Centre
hawkers.description: Commonly known as Cheng San Market and Cooked Food Centre, Blk 527 Ang Mo Kio Ave 10 is one of the three hawker centres located along Ang Mo Kio Ave 10. The hawker centre was built in 1979 to serve the dining and marketing needs of nearby residents. Upgraded in 2004, it houses 50 cooked food stalls and 100 market stalls.

hawkers.name: Blk 538 Bedok North Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Built in 1979, the hawker centre at Blk 538 Bedok North Street 3 comprises 42 cooked food stalls and 134 market stalls. One of the popular hawker centres in the Bedok area.

hawkers.name: 58 New Upper Changi Road Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Comprising a market produce and cooked food section, the hawker centre at Blk 58 New Upper Changi Road was built in 1978 to serve the marketing and dining needs of patrons living in Bedok South. Especially popular during the breakfast and lunch hours.

hawkers.name: Tanjong Pagar Plaza Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Located near the Tanjong Pagar Plaza, the hawker centre serves some of the locals' favourite dishes such as Hainanese Chicken Rice, Curry Fish Head and Seafood Soup. Built in 1977, the centre has 52 cooked food stalls and 108 market stalls to serve the needs of the patrons.

hawkers.name: Ang Mo Kio 628 Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Originally built in 1979, the hawker centre is located opposite Yio Chu Kang CC and near schools, temples and residential flats.   After the upgrading in 2010, the rebuilt centre consists of  52 cooked food stalls and 166 market stalls to serve the marketingand dining needs of patrons.

hawkers.name: Bedok Reservoir Road Blk 630 Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Located within walking distance from the Eunos Community Club, the centre is a convenient place which meets the dining and marketing needs of residents living at Bedok Reservoir Road. Upgraded in 2006, it houses 36 cooked food stalls and 75 market stalls.

hawkers.name: Geylang Bahru Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Located near amenities such as swimming pool, industrial parks, commercial shops and residential estates, Blk 69 Geylang Bahru is a focal point where patrons get to enjoy local hawker fare at affordable prices. The hawker centre was built in 1974 and houses 84 cooked food stalls cum 127 market stalls.

hawkers.name: Empress Road Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Built in 1976, the hawker centre at Blk 7 Empress Road comprises 40 cooked food stalls and 72 market stalls. Provides marketing and dining facilities to residents of Farrer estate.

hawkers.name: Blk 724 Ang Mo Kio Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Located conveniently in the heart of the bustling Ang Mo Kio Town Centre, the hawker centre is always packed with patrons, especially during the weekends.  Be prepared to queue for your favourite food at popular stalls!

hawkers.name: Blk 726 Clementi Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Built in 1980, the hawker centre at Blk 726 Clementi West Street 2 consists of 60 cooked food stalls and 135 market stalls. The centre is conveniently located in close proximity to schools, housing estates and shopping complex.

hawkers.name: Toa Payoh Vista Market
hawkers.description: Built in 1980, the hawker centre at Blk 726 Clementi West Street 2 consists of 60 cooked food stalls and 135 market stalls. The centre is conveniently located in close proximity to schools, housing estates and shopping complex.

hawkers.name: Toa Payoh Food Centre
hawkers.description: Built in 1968, this standalone food centre at Blk 75 Lorong 5 Toa Payoh comprises 36 cooked food stalls.

hawkers.name: 79 Redhill Lane Market Centre
hawkers.description: Built in 1969, the standalone market offers a variety of fresh market produce to serve the needs of Redhill residents. The centre was upgraded in 2005 and comprises 122 market stalls.  Within walking distance from Redhill MRT.

hawkers.name: Telok Blangah Food Centre
hawkers.description: Situated directly opposite the Telok Blangah Community Centre, the hawker centre is a convenient location where residents of Telok Blangah can get to enjoy palatable local cuisines at affordable rates from the 40 cooked food stalls.

hawkers.name: Circuit Road Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Built in 1967, the hawker centre at Blk 80 Circuit Road comprises 16 cooked food stalls and 43 market stalls. One of the three hawker centres serving the residents living in the vicinity of Circuit Road.

hawkers.name: 82 Telok Blangah Drive Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Built in 1972, the standalone market at Blk 82 Telok Blangah Drive offers a variety of fresh produce where residents can fulfill their marketing needs. Comprises 144 market stalls.

hawkers.name: 84 Marine Parade Central Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Located across Parkway Parade Shopping Centre, the hawker centre has been around since 1976. It is popular with patrons throughout the day. A wide variety of local food is available at the hawker centre including Char Kway Teow, Beef Noodles, Economical Rice, Desserts etc.  Comprises 55 cooked food stalls and 143 market stalls.

hawkers.name: 85 Fengshan Centre
hawkers.description: A popular supper destination for night owls from all over the island.  The hawker centre features a wide array of hawker fare such as Bak Chor Mee, Porridge, BBQ Chicken Wings and Seafood, Fried Oysters etc.  Definitely a favourite haunt for the sleepless!

hawkers.name: Redhill Lane Block 85 Food Centre
hawkers.description: Build in 1972 to complement the market next door, Blk 85 Redhill Lane is a standalone food centre comprising 96 cooked food stalls. A good variety of food can be found within the hawker centre.  Within walking distance from Redhill MRT.

hawkers.name: Block 89 Circuit Road Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Built in 1967, the hawker centre at Blk 89 Circuit Road comprises 40 cooked food stalls and 93 market stalls. One of the three hawker centres serving the residents living in the vicinity of Circuit Road.

hawkers.name: Whampoa Drive Block 90 Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Known also as Whampoa Drive Makan Place, this is one hawker centre in Singapore which has become inceasingly famous over the years. Patrons can easily find popular stalls serving up excellent dishes to satisfy their palate. Be prepared to wait during peak hours as the premise is packed with diners!

hawkers.name: Blk 93 Lorong 4 Toa Payoh Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Built in 1967, the hawker centre at Blk 93 Lorong 4 Toa Payoh comprises 28 cooked food stalls and 32 market stalls. Originally a double-storey building, the centre was converted to a single-storey one after upgrading in 2009.

hawkers.name: Haig Road Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Built in 1977, the hawker centre at Blk 13/14 Haig Road is easily visible from Changi Road. Comprising 72 cooked food stalls and 146 market stalls, its ideal location as well as the wide selection of affordable hawker fare have attracted many residents and working professionals around the vicinity.

hawkers.name: Blks 160/162 Ang Mo Kio Ave 4 (Market & Hawker Centre)
hawkers.description: Commonly known as Mayflower Market, the hawker centre was built in 1981. It comprises 40 cooked food stalls and 84 market stalls to serve the marketing and dining needs of residents.

hawkers.name: Tanglin Halt Food Centre
hawkers.description: Nestled within the established Tanglin Halt estate, the food centre was originally built in 1981. The three hexagonal blocks retain their unique shape after upgrading in 2009. A total of 40 cooked food stalls is housed within the centre.

hawkers.name: Changi Village Hawker Centre
hawkers.description: Located at the eastern end of Singapore near to Changi Point Ferry Terminal and Changi Beach, the popular hawker centre draws food lovers from all over the island. Be wowed by the great variety of  hawker fare available e.g. Nasi Lemak, BBQ Seafood, Fried Wan Ton Noodles etc.  Built in 1975, this centre comprises 87 cooked food stalls and 50 market stalls.

hawkers.name: Marsiling Lane Food Centre
hawkers.description: Built in 1975, the hawker centre at Blk 20/21 Marsiling Road houses 52 cooked food stalls and 112 market stalls.  Upgraded in 2009.

hawkers.name: Boon Lay Place Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Located beside Boon Lay Shopping Centre, the hawker centre at Blk 221A/B Boon Lay Place provides marketing and dining amenities for residents living in Boon Lay. Built in 1976, the centre comprises 72 cooked food stalls and 94 market stalls.

hawkers.name: Havelock Cooked Food Centre
hawkers.description: Built in 1969, the standalone hawker centre located in the Havelock area comprises 30 cooked food stalls. It was upgraded in 2007.

hawkers.name: Circuit Road Food Centre
hawkers.description: Built in 1971, the hawker centre is sited beside the Pelton Canal in Paya Lebar. One of the three hawker centres at Ciruit Road, the centre comprises 106 cooked food stalls. After upgrading in 2010, a new outdoor refreshment area has been added to provide a unique alfresco dining experience to patrons.

hawkers.name: Whampoa Hawker Centre
hawkers.description: Known also as Whampoa Drive Makan Place, this is one hawker centre in Singapore which has become inceasingly famous over the years. Patrons can easily find popular stalls serving up excellent dishes to satisfy their palate. Be prepared to wait during peak hours as the premise is packed with diners!

hawkers.name: Chinatown Complex Food Centre
hawkers.description: Original built in 1983, Blk 335 Smith Street is also commonly known as Chinatown Complex. It is the largest hawker centre in Singapore comprising a total of 703 stalls! After upgrading in 2008, the building has been transformed into an architecture of strong Chinese influence with a modern twist. Situated in the Chinatown area, the centre now comes with better amenities and increased seating capacity. A favourite hang-out place for residents to reminisce good old days while enjoying the wide array of local dishes offered.

hawkers.name: Chong Pang Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Built in 1984, the hawker centre comprises 56 cooked food stalls and 123 market stalls. Residents of Chong Pang patronise the centre for its wide selection of local cuisines.

hawkers.name: Hong Lim Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Also known as Hong Lim Food Centre, the hawker centre is famous for dishes such as Bak Ku Teh, Crayfish Hor Fun, Curry Chicken Noodles, Fish Head Bee Hoon etc. Expect to see long queues at different stalls, especially during lunch hours. Apart from the 103 cooked food stalls, the hawker centre also has 40 market stalls to serve the needs of the residents in the vicinity.

hawkers.name: Kovan Market & Food Centre
hawkers.description: Conveniently situated in the heartlands of Kovan, the hawker centre at Blk 209 Hougang Street 21 is minutes away from Kovan MRT. Built in 1983, the centre houses 65 cooked food stalls and 118 market stalls. Be prepared to queue for your favourite dish at the popular cooked food stalls within the hawker centre!

hawkers.name: Cambridge Road Blk 41A (Pek Kio Market and Food Centre)
hawkers.description: More commonly known as Pek Kio Market and Food Centre, the hawker centre was built in 1981 to serve residents staying nearby.  The centre was upgraded in 2003 and currently houses 50 cooked food stalls and 74 market stalls. Many stalls offer delicious yet suprisingly affordable dishes. Get ready for a gastronomic experience!

hawkers.name: People's Park Food Centre
hawkers.description: Fondly known as People's Park Complex, it is located right in the heart of the bustling Chinatown. It is a favourite haunt for elderly folks to catch up and enjoy a delicious yet affordable meal.  Extremely accessible by bus or MRT. Upgraded in 2005, it has 87 cooked food stalls located on the ground floor. The second and third floors comprise HDB shops selling fabrics, fashion and home wares.

hawkers.name: Tekka Market
hawkers.description: More commonly known as Tekka Centre, the hawker centre is a popular haunt for marketing and dining needs, especially with the Indian community. An amazing variety of fresh produce is sold at the market.  Built in 1980, it is the second largest hawker centre in Singapore housing more than 400 stalls. An iconic landmark in the Little India area!
